definition: to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: It's tempting to listen to her urgings and do just as the says.
sentences.chinese: 听她的劝说并照她说的去做是一件很吸引人的事。

sentences.english: Her persuasions were to no avail. （end in a failure）
sentences.chinese: 她的劝说以失败而告终。

sentences.english: A bully is not reasonable - he is persuaded only by threats.
sentences.chinese: 跟恶棍无法讲道理，恶棍只能以威吓劝说。

sentences.english: In Wang Zhiqiang persuasion, the son agreed to see her father often.
sentences.chinese: 在王志强的劝说下，大儿子同意经常去看看父亲。

sentences.english: But podiatrists urge caution before running without shoes.
sentences.chinese: 但是足病诊疗师劝说在赤脚跑步之前一定要小心。

sentences.english: Friendly persuasion is the stock-in-trade of every salesman.
sentences.chinese: 友好的劝说是每个推销员的惯用手法。

sentences.english: TangLi constantly persuade TianXin this is just a small operation.
sentences.chinese: 唐力不断劝说田心这只是一个小手术。

sentences.english: Xia Qing persuade our public identity.
sentences.chinese: 我们劝说夏青公开身份。

sentences.english: I was hyped up  by his persuasive remarks.
sentences.chinese: 他的一番劝说令我兴奋起来。

sentences.english: The foundation-stone of persuasive speech is what Aristotle in the 4th century BC described as the "ethos" appeal.
sentences.chinese: 劝说式演讲最早为公元前4世纪亚里士多德时期的。

sentences.english: Burch, a parish leader, pleading with his colleagues for road spending.
sentences.chinese: Burch这样劝说他的同事花钱修路。

sentences.english: It's easy to persuade them, if you go the right way about it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你劝说得法，说服他们是不难的。

sentences.english: No matter how hard everyone tried to persuade him, he just wouldn't listen.
sentences.chinese: 不管大家怎么劝说，他高低不听。

sentences.english: It is a sad fact that she was pulled into the marriage with that man.
sentences.chinese: 她被劝说同那个男人结了婚，这是件可悲的事。

sentences.english: Persuade YangJian going back to changan to see how much YangYong change.
sentences.chinese: 劝说杨坚先回长安看看杨勇改变了多少。

sentences.english: We shall have to stroke the old man down before we go out tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我们今晚出去之前得劝说那位老人息怒。

definition: to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
earnest and well-meaning advice (idiom); to persuade patiently
to persuade/to convince/to talk sb over/Taiwan pr. [shui4 fu2]
over and over again/again and again
to try one's very best to persuade sb (idiom)/to reason with sb in every way possible
to be determined to/to insist on
